chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell D Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing. Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Pay restitution, fine and mandatory costs and surcharges from prison funds, including wages and all other moneys, in an amount or percentage the Dept. (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. Balance would be then paid while on Extended Supervision. Failure to pay the amounts will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No controlled substances or alcohol.
- NO CONTACT with the victim's family.

- AODA assessment; treatment if needed.
- Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court informed the defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.

Material Witness, Wesley Walker, NOT in court.  Attorney Christopher Hartley appears for Defendant.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is here regarding the $5,000 bail on Material Witness, Wesley Walker.  The Court VACATED the warrant and orders the $5,000 bail VACATED.  No objection from the State nor Defense.  The Court orders all bail conditions VACATED regarding THIS CASE.  The Material Witness has other pending matters.  Those matters are seperate from this matter.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Amending the charges from First Degree Reckless Homicide While Armed, 940.02(1) and 939.63 to Homicide By Negligent Handling of a Dangerous Weapon, 940.08(1), received and filed.

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  The State filed an Amended Information, amending the charges from First Degree Reckless Homicide, 940.02(1) to Homicide By Negligent Handling of a Dangerous Weapon, 940.08(1).  The Defendant has decided to plea guility to the charge in the Amended Information.  AS TO COUNT #1:  (AS AMENDED):  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

The Court VACATED the March 6, 2017 Jury Trial date.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter set for sentencing on March 10, 2017 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

to Withdraw, received and filed.
with TURNOVER to Justice Point with the following conditions:  (1) GPS Monitoring; (2) 24-hour curfew; and (3) Defendant to reside at the address provided to the Court (kept under seal)

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Darnell D Walker in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bud Stein appears with witness, Shantia J.

Matter here for a Jury Trial.  The State is not ready to proceed due to an essential witness that is missing.  The State requested an adjournment.  The Defense objected.  The Court GRANTED the State's request for an adjournment.  The State requested that the Defendant be released on a signature bond.  No objection from the Defense.  The Defense motioned for the case to be DISMISSED.  The Court DENIED that motion.  The Court GRANTS the State's request and orders the Defendant released on a $10,000 signature bond with TURNOVER to Justice Point, GPS monitoring and a 24-hour curfew.  The Court orders that the Defendant is to reside at the address indicated to the Court.  The Court indicated that if Defendant needs to meet with his attorney, Attorney Steinle needs to file a motion for the Court to approve.  Attorney Bud Stein motioned to withdraw as attorney for witness, Shanita J.  The Court GRANTED Attorney Stein's Motion.  Matter set for a final pre-trial on February 24, 2017 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial on March 6, 2017 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Pretrial Release Conditions Order
signed and filed

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Darnell D Walker in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bud Stein appears for witness, Shantia J.

Matter here for a Bail/Bond hearing for witness, Shantia J.  The Court sets bail for witness, Shantia J., in the amount of $10,000 cash.  A deposition was then taken of witness, Shantia W.  Exhibits #1, #2, #3 and #4, received and later retained with original transcripts.  After the deposition was completed, the State served witness, Shantia J., with a subpoena to appear at the September 19, 2016 Jury Trial date.  Attorney Stein acknowledges receipt of the subpoena on behalf of the Defendant.  The State requested bail be modified as to witness, Shantia J.  Arguments heard.  The Court sets bail for witness, Shantia J., at $1,000 signature bond.  Matter set for a Jury Trial on September 19, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

FILED, Exhibit List

Back on the record outside the presence of parties.  As people were leaving the courtroom gallery, one person was taking pictures of defendant.  Court ordered the individual taken into custody.  Court advised the individual of the penalties of courtroom misconduct and contempt of court.  Court admonished the individual and ordered them released from custody.
ON MATERIAL WITNESS ONLY:  Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Material witness, Wesley Walker, failing to appear.  Court being reliably advised that witness has been duly subpoenaed and served, court ordered a body attachment issued for default witness.  BODY ATTACHMENT ISSUED and given directly to the Sheriff's Deputies.

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Darnell D Walker in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Attorney Golden in court on behalf of material witness. Wesley Walker. State makes record as to material witness Wesley Walker.  State's motion to issue a warrant for the defaulting witness, Wesley Walker, granted by the Court.  Court ordered that a bench warrant be issued for the defaulting witness and the $500.00 cash bail previously posted be forfeited.  

Arguments heard as to how to proceed.  Defense motion to dismiss, denied by the court.  For reasons stated on the record, court finds good cause to extend speedy trial demand time limits.  

Court addressed issue of another defaulting witness who is in custody.  State requests a bail/bond hearing. 

Court orders case adjourned for bail/bond hearing and jury trial in Br 30.  Bail/bond hearing schedled for August 8, 2016 at 1:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 8:30 am.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:33 am.  At the hour of 12:04 pm jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:30 pm.

Case scheduled for jury trial.  In-chambers discussions placed on the record.  Statements by state as to witness issues.  Witness in court with attorney Andrew Golden.  Court holds discussions with witness as to testifying.  Case passed.  

Back on record, same appearances.  States offer put on the record. Defendant rejects States offer.  Parties discussed how the trial will proceed.

Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REYNA MORALES, PUBLIC DEFENDER, 819 N. 6TH ST. #908, MILW. WI  53203.

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Darnell D Walker in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nicholas Johnson-MPD Detective.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Additional charge (ct. 2) added.

Defendant Darnell D Walker in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Darnell D Walker in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
